body.p: Upgrade from Beta1 to Beta2 is now supported. To preform the upgrade, yu must have a working deployment of the Beta1 release.

To perform the upgrade, follow the steps below. The upgrade will apply necessary changes to HP Helion OpenStack services, as well as to the underlying cloud platform. OS kernel updates are not performed at this time.
Log in to the deployer node as the user you created during the beta1 deployment, and mount the beta2 install media at /media/cdrom, for example: sudo mount hLinux-cattleprod-amd64-blaster-netinst-20150901-hlm.<build-date_sha1>.iso /media/cdrom
Unpack the following tarball: Note this file name will change (NOTE: the new release is still called beta1, change is pending): tar zxvf /media/cdrom/hos-2.0.0/hos-2.0.0-b.1-20150908T154315Z.tgz Run the included initialisation script to update the deployer (NOTE: the new release is still called beta1, change is pending): ~/hos-2.0.0-b.1/hos-init.bash
Prepare the new Ansible tree for the upgrade task:
Resolve any merge conflicts that may have arisen: cd ~/helion git status etc. etc.
Run the config processor: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible/ ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Run the ready deployment script: ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Run the upgrade playbook: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts hlm-upgrade.yml
